etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek helenion. The term originally denoted the herb elecampane, possibly in commemoration of Helen of Troy (said to have planted elecampane on the island of Pharos); the current designation was adopted by Linnaeus in the 18th century

definitions: an American plant of the daisy family, which bears many red to yellow flowers, each having a prominent central disk.

notes.text: Genus Helenium, family Compositae: many species, especially the sneezeweeds
